All Implemented Interfaces:
MeltingComputationMethod
public class MarmurSchildkrautDoty
extends ApproximativeMode

This class represents the model schdot. It extedns ApproximativeMode. James G. Wetmur, "DNA Probes : applications of the principles of nucleic acid hybridization", 1991, Critical reviews in biochemistry and molecular biology, 26, 227-259 Marmur J, Doty P, "Determination of the base composition of deoxyribonucleic acid from its thermal denaturation temperature", 1962, Journal of molecular biology, 5, 109-118. Chester N, Marshak DR, "dimethyl sulfoxide-mediated primer Tm reduction : a method for analyzing the role of renaturation temperature in the polymerase chain reaction", 1993, Analytical Biochemistry, 209, 284-290. Schildkraut C, Lifson S, "Dependance of the melting temperature of DNA on salt concentration", 1965, Biopolymers, 3, 95-110. Wahl GM, Berger SL, Kimmel AR. Molecular hybridization of immobilized nucleic acids: theoretical concepts and practical considerations. Methods Enzymol 1987;152:399 – 407. Britten RJ, Graham DE, Neufeld BR. Analysis of repeating DNA sequences by reassociation. Methods Enzymol 1974;29:363–418. Hall TJ, Grula JW, Davidson EH, Britten RJ. Evolution of sea urchin non-repetitive DNA. J Mol Evol 1980;16:95–110.

public ThermoResult computesThermodynamics()
Description copied from interface: MeltingComputationMethod
This method is called to compute the melting temperature.

Specified by:
computesThermodynamics in interface MeltingComputationMethod
Overrides:
computesThermodynamics in class ApproximativeMode
Returns:
ThermoResult containing the computed enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature.

isApplicable

public boolean isApplicable()
Description copied from interface: MeltingComputationMethod
This method is called to check that the options entered by the users are applicable with the used model (class).

Specified by:
isApplicable in interface MeltingComputationMethod
Overrides:
isApplicable in class ApproximativeMode
Returns:
false if at least one chosen option makes the model completely false. If one chosen option may lead to less reliable results, a warning message will appear. (ex : wrong hybridization type)
